p: Consistent with previous studies, spouse having syphilis was a risk factor for T. pallidum infection in females [ 32] while syphilis was associated with drug abuse in males. Sharing syringes and drug related sexual activities dramatically increase the risk of T. pallidum infection [ 33, 34]. IDUs who engage in unprotected sex, place their female spouses at high risk for STDs [ 35]. It is common for Yi drug users to engage in sexual behaviors with no condom [ 36], and the proportion of condom use is extremely low [ 37]. Therefore, females are highly vulnerable to T. pallidum infection due to their unprotected sexual contacts with their high-risk husbands.
